div.div: WHEN GLASS JAW REFERS TO A TYPE OF TUMOR

div.a: Cancer Fears Could Prevent Glass From Ever Becoming A Phone

div.div: Google Glass lacks the ability to connect to a cellular network on its own. It can only access one through a wireless Bluetooth connection to the wearer’s cell phone. The question is: why?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YYDCop&via=Digg&text=Cancer Fears Could Prevent Glass From Ever Becoming A Phone

div.div: ROOM GETS VERY COLD WHEN YOU SEE IT

div.a: Scientists Uncover Invisible Motion In Video

div.div: A 30-second video of a newborn baby shows the infant silently snoozing in its crib, his breathing barely perceptible. But when the video is run through an algorithm that can amplify both movement and color, the baby’s face blinks crimson with each tiny heartbeat.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZB2fsf&via=Digg&text=Scientists Uncover Invisible Motion In Video

div.a: The Best And Craziest Ideas At The ARPA-E Future Energy Pitching Session

div.div: The ideas on the table ranged from innovative geometries for vehicle natural gas tanks to wireless electric vehicle charging schemes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y3o4QQ&via=Digg&text=The Best And Craziest Ideas At The ARPA-E Future Energy Pitching Session

div.a: How Auto-Tune Conquered Pop Music

div.div: Since rising to fame as the weird techno-warble effect in the chorus of Cher’s 1998 song, “Believe,” Auto-Tune has become bitchy shorthand for saying somebody can’t sing. But the diss isn’t fair, because everybody’s using it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/15iVaj9&via=Digg&text=How Auto-Tune Conquered Pop Music

div.a: The Most Intricate Fictional Narrative In The History Of The World

div.div: For just over half a century, there’s been another America running alongside our own, where colorfully dressed misfits solve crimes, protect the weak, and have explosive misunderstandings.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YYVnnB&via=Digg&text=The Most Intricate Fictional Narrative In The History Of The World

div.a: The Dark Secret Of The Only Car To Appear On American Paper Money

div.div: The government would love to keep you from knowing any of this. But I won't keep quiet anymore. I'm gonna blow the lid off this thing once and for all, and tell you all the dark, disgusting, and filthy secrets behind the only car ever to appear on US money. It's on the back of the ten-dollar bill.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WiHX9K&via=Digg&text=The Dark Secret Of The Only Car To Appear On American Paper Money

div.a: The Virus That Learns

div.div: If you don’t have an immune system, you don’t last long in this parasite-riddled world.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13o32RU&via=Digg&text=The Virus That Learns

div.a: How A Bush Aide Got 80 Republicans To Come Out For Marriage Equality

div.div: Ken Mehlman says he is pushing for same-sex couples' marriage rights “because we are conservatives, not in spite of it.” Here's how he got 80 prominent Republicans to join him in the fight.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VMq3cJ&via=Digg&text=How A Bush Aide Got 80 Republicans To Come Out For Marriage Equality

div.div: PHOTO ESSAYS YOU NEED TO READ

div.a: A Portrait Of Domestic Violence

div.div: Domestic violence is often shielded from public view. Usually, we only hear it muffled through walls or see it manifested in the faded yellow and purple bruises of a woman who “walked into a wall” or “fell down the stairs.” This photo essay makes it incredibly real.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y23qkc&via=Digg&text=A Portrait Of Domestic Violence

div.div: OR HOW TO LOSE TO FACEBOOK

div.a: An Autopsy Of A Dead Social Network

div.div: Following the collapse of the social network Friendster, computer scientists have carried out a digital autopsy to find out what went wrong.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZI3VE3&via=Digg&text=An Autopsy Of A Dead Social Network

div.a: The Top 37 Pope Tweets Of All Time

div.div: His Twitter account may be a bit wordy and preachy, but to bid Benedict farewell, we've ranked his messages from best to worst regardless.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XG7hBv&via=Digg&text=The Top 37 Pope Tweets Of All Time

div.a: How You — And Dennis Rodman — Can Visit North Korea

div.div: Did you know you can actually travel to North Korea, and it's not even that difficult to do?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZJmuro&via=Digg&text=How You — And Dennis Rodman — Can Visit North Korea

div.a: Award Winning Washington Post Photo Disqualified For Being Photoshopped

div.div: The above photo was the version that was submitted to and won the White House News Photographers Association’s (WHNPA) ‘Eyes of History’ stills photo contest, but not before it was significantly manipulated in Photoshop.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YzTVrS&via=Digg&text=Award Winning Washington Post Photo Disqualified For Being Photoshopped

div.a: This Woman Spent A Year Assembling a 400,000 Piece LEGO Replica Of Hogwarts

div.div: This is Alice Finch and her 400,000-piece LEGO replica (including interiors!) of the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YWSbZE&via=Digg&text=This Woman Spent A Year Assembling a 400,000 Piece LEGO Replica Of Hogwarts

div.a: Nike's Employee Number One

div.div: A road trip with Jeff Johnson, Nike's original wage-earner, unveils a treasure of running history.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZJ8QEw&via=Digg&text=Nike's Employee Number One

div.a: Wretches Of The Hidden Temple

div.div: In the mid-1990s, hundreds of kids attempted the Temple Run in Nickelodeon's Legends of the Hidden Temple. Most of them failed, and miserably. Roll the tape.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Va8dBn&via=Digg&text=Wretches Of The Hidden Temple

div.a: Is Dennis Tito Planning A Manned Mission To Mars In 2018?

div.div: The reaction from the space community has ranged from bemusement and disbelief to encouragement and awe.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WqX8s5&via=Digg&text=Is Dennis Tito Planning A Manned Mission To Mars In 2018?

div.div: SO JUST EXPECT THE WORST ALL THE TIME

div.a: Pain Can Turn To Pleasure If Less Intense Than Expected

div.div: A new study suggests that when something causes less pain than expected, it is possible for the experience of this pain to feel pleasant.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13VVvFI&via=Digg&text=Pain Can Turn To Pleasure If Less Intense Than Expected

div.div: BUT CAN YOU PROVE HE ISN'T?

div.a: Kanye West: I Am Steve Jobs

div.div: What would he look like in a black turtleneck?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YzBuBk&via=Digg&text=Kanye West: I Am Steve Jobs

div.div: JUST WHAT HE WOULD HAVE WANTED

div.a: Francis Crick's Nobel Prize To Be Sold Off
@virginiahughes
5h ago

div.div: Kinda sad, Francis Crick's granddaughter is putting his Nobel up for auction. (+ his "soiled lab coat", yuch) npr.org/blogs/thetwo-way/2...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YFhCkn&via=Digg&text=Francis Crick's Nobel Prize To Be Sold Off

div.a: How Is Beer Pong Different From Beer Bong?

div.div: The point of all drinking games is to get drunk. But which one gets you the drunkest? Scientists decided to find out. For science.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y3E0CK&via=Digg&text=How Is Beer Pong Different From Beer Bong?

div.div: COMMUTING TO THE COUCH IS JUST BETTER

div.a: Marissa Mayer Has Made A Terrible Mistake

div.div: Working from home is great for employees—and employers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V6LEO3&via=Digg&text=Marissa Mayer Has Made A Terrible Mistake

div.a: African Kids See White Man For The First Time And Freak Out Over His Arm Hair

div.div: A group of kids in Congo meet a white man for the first time.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y3Aetd&via=Digg&text=African Kids See White Man For The First Time And Freak Out Over His Arm Hair

div.a: What Political Leaders Did Before They Took Office

div.div: Here's a quick look at what political leaders in different countries did for a living before they took office.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y0Ix6c&via=Digg&text=What Political Leaders Did Before They Took Office

div.a: The Problem With Inventing A Dating App That Women Will Use

div.div: The eligible men are laid out like items on a menu that I can scroll through by flicking my thumb. I haven’t even tapped on a single photo yet when—brrring—a new message appears: “Wassup?” I ignore it and return my attention to the sea of forty-five-year-old men with usernames like “Drunky.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZJ4YU9&via=Digg&text=The Problem With Inventing A Dating App That Women Will Use

div.a: Tragic Footage Of The Hot Air Balloon Crash In Egypt

div.div: Raw footage of the tragic balloon crash in Egypt that killed 19 tourists.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y3gsOt&via=Digg&text=Tragic Footage Of The Hot Air Balloon Crash In Egypt

div.a: Inside The Amazing New Google Offices In Tel Aviv

div.div: Just when you thought your office space was cool, here comes a new Google office design.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y3fVMk&via=Digg&text=Inside The Amazing New Google Offices In Tel Aviv

div.a: Can U.S. Embassies Be Safe Without Being Unsightly?

div.div: There's been a tug of war between aesthetically pleasing and safe when it comes to American embassies around the world.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13jeX3C&via=Digg&text=Can U.S. Embassies Be Safe Without Being Unsightly?

div.a: In The Footsteps Of A Killer

div.div: Fifty rapes. Ten murders. Two identities. One man. From 1976 to 1986, one of the most violent serial criminals in American history terrorized communities throughout California. He was little known, never caught, and might still be out there.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YYYxHQ&via=Digg&text=In The Footsteps Of A Killer

div.a: This 3D Printed Car Is As Strong As Steel, Half The Weight, And Nearing Production

div.div: 3D printing could revolutionize parts manufacturing while creating a cottage industry of small-batch automakers intent on challenging the status quo. And the Urbee 2 is the first step.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13jawpw&via=Digg&text=This 3D Printed Car Is As Strong As Steel, Half The Weight, And Nearing Production

div.a: Man Invents Machine To Separate And De-Cream Oreos

div.div: It doesn't matter which part of the Oreo is your favorite. Fans of both the cookie and the cream will find this video hysterical.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VNlX47&via=Digg&text=Man Invents Machine To Separate And De-Cream Oreos

div.a: Great White Shark Fatally Attacks Man In New Zealand As Police Fire At Least 20 Times

div.div: An award-winning film and TV director was mauled to death by a Great White shark as he swam off a popular New Zealand tourist beach.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YY9OZ0&via=Digg&text=Great White Shark Fatally Attacks Man In New Zealand As Police Fire At Least 20 Times

div.a: Why You Pay More At The Grocery Store (And How To Stop)

div.div: It isn't hard to guess which items in the grocery store have the highest mark-ups; after all, you won't see a fancy display around cabbages or low-fat milk.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZxJA0i&via=Digg&text=Why You Pay More At The Grocery Store (And How To Stop)

div.a: The Annotated Wisdom Of Louis C.K.

div.div: Louis C.K. talks a lot. It's his job. Here are the 70 wisest and funniest things he's ever said.
